page.title: 06Farming in Blackfield
page.content: { { }In our area we have three farms. These are{Badminston Farm,Stonehills and{Field}Farm.Stonehill farm is a poultry farm it was a dairy farm.They have around 170 to 200 hens.They are {Road Island Red}and{Shaver}high breed. They breed the Shaver high breed of the Road Island Red.The farm used to be 10 acres,now it is only 3.5 acres. The owners are Mr and Mrs.Manuel.It is now a small holding.It is about 170 to 200 years old.It has a pig sty,but it doesn't have any pigs.There are some ducks,horses and cows. About 50 years ago Mr.Peat (our school care-taker)worked at Badminston Farm.The largest farm is Badminston Farm,it is also the oldest.It has hessian on the walls to keep out the cold.Stonehills is the smallest farm.
